titlestmt.titleproper: Warren B. Snow books of U.S. cent auctions and sales, before 1972
titlestmt.author: David Hill

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by David Hill using EADitor ©2014

change.item: Imported into EADitor. Some normalization has occurred to apply EAD 2002 schema validation and conform to EADitor basic requirements.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Warren B. Snow books of U.S. cent auctions and sales
did.abstract: Two handwritten notebooks and one mimeographed book containing records of U.S. cent auctions and sales.

daodesc.head: Warren B. Snow books of U.S. cent auctions and sales, before 1972

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Three books containing records of U.S. cent auctions and sales: (1) “Proofs of Large Cents Listed in Auctions, Private Sales, and Fixed Price Lists,” a handwritten listing from 1855 to 1971; (2) a spiral notebook with handwritten listings categorized by coin dealer from 1858 to 1967; and (3) the mimeographed “Large Proof Cents, 1817-1857: Auction Record and Data over the Last 14 Years, 1946-1960.”

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Chemical engineer Warren B. Snow (b. 1919?) of Nashua, New Hampshire, became a member of the American Numismatic Society in 1961. He was a collector of large and small U.S. cents with a particular interest in large proof cents.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Warren B. Snow books of U.S. cent auctions and sales, before 1972, Archives, American Numismatic Society.

userestrict.head: Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright restrictions may apply. Permission to publish or reproduce must be secured from the American Numismatic Society.
